The new Government of Bolivia was still unrecognized by the United States when Boal left post on February 5, 1944.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recess appointment expired on January 2, 1951; recommissioned on January 3, 1951, after confirmation. Reappointed on June 26, 1951.

The new Government of Bolivia had not been recognized by the United States when Weissman left post on July 20, 1980.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; did not serve under this appointment.
Nominated on February 25, 1856; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Declined appointment.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
Not commissioned; nomination not confirmed by the Senate.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
